intro: Labichea punctata, commonly known as the spotted labichea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with lobed margins and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Labichea punctata is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
